channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Former Attorney General Bill Barr suggested Donald Trump had grown "detached from reality" on his election fraud claims, as multiple aides testified to the House Jan. 6 committee they told him he'd lost. https://t.co/ePvQiEoaOH https://t.co/4aSQt2itzs

Meet Daniel Naroditsky, the New York Times's new chess columnist. He's an author, tutor and chess grandmaster — the highest title given to competitors by the International Chess Federation. He will be publishing his first Times chess puzzle on Monday. https://t.co/ZbjT7mlSFa
The FDA on Monday approved a drug that restores hair growth in many alopecia patients by blocking the immune system from attacking hair follicles. https://t.co/zxfmWCsdlh

The Jan. 6 committee said that Donald Trump’s campaign, a related political action committee and his allies raised $250 million by claiming they were fighting widespread election fraud at a time when they knew there was none. https://t.co/tESBYTZ9dU https://t.co/TSvFeVj2ih

A mountain in Yellowstone National Park, named for an Army officer who led a massacre in which at least 173 Native Americans were slaughtered, has been renamed First Peoples Mountain in honor of America’s Indigenous people, the National Park Service said. https://t.co/z2RgaiBuxk

On the second day of hearings, the Jan. 6 committee used interviews with Donald Trump’s own family and closest advisers to illustrate how he rejected advice and falsely claimed he won the election. https://t.co/Ohi2vmFIHV https://t.co/vXjzcSNJer

The House Jan. 6 committee hearing included testimony from Chris Stirewalt, the former political editor of Fox News, who described in detail his data-driven analysis that concluded on election night that President Trump had lost. https://t.co/OXnOEsi6A5 https://t.co/HgO249sdPw

Former Attorney General Bill Barr suggested Donald Trump had grown "detached from reality" on his election fraud claims, as multiple aides testified to the House Jan. 6 committee they told him he'd lost. https://t.co/hz63dMOD8M https://t.co/0ge515g0x4
Kevin Spacey was charged with four counts of sexual assault on Monday in London. The actor will appear in a London court on Thursday to start a likely lengthy trial. https://t.co/uXcxXcBacK

The one big theme on the second day of the Jan. 6 committee's hearings was that Donald Trump was told repeatedly that his "big lie" about a fraudulent election was baseless — but he made the fake claim on election night anyway. Here are some takeaways. https://t.co/21zr7nVfIk

In Opinion
Reforming Australia’s gun laws was possible thanks largely to “the shared norm of bipartisanship and the willingness of conservatives, acting on principle, to risk alienating their base,” says Aaron Timms, a writer from Sydney, in a guest essay.https://t.co/4iWjnZzQOf

The House Jan. 6 committee hearing focused on the origins and spread of President Trump’s lie of a stolen election, including efforts to raise money off the false claims. https://t.co/brudl2F0zQ https://t.co/ij3nPyQSZM

Breaking News: Donald Trump’s aides testified to the House Jan. 6 committee, one after another, that they told him claims of a stolen election were bogus, but that he pushed them anyway. https://t.co/1yFAit4zYC

Russia earned what is very likely a record 93 billion euros in revenue from exports of oil, gas and coal in the first 100 days of the country’s invasion of Ukraine. The revenue exceeds what Russia is spending on the war. https://t.co/bNJuqRRsmf

The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack began Monday’s hearing with its chairman laying out how it would show that Donald Trump knowingly spread the lie that the 2020 election was stolen from him. https://t.co/tK1k8sH8YK https://t.co/b4kvYrz49O
Al Horford, the Boston Celtics center, is the first Dominican player in the N.B.A. finals. With the way he’s competing, it’s hard to tell he hasn’t been here before. https://t.co/x74S7D99rE
Breaking News: A new Ohio law cuts the training required for teachers and staff to carry guns in schools to a maximum of 24 hours, down from 700. https://t.co/3QG6sWZcCK

Breaking News: Former Attorney General Bill Barr suggested Donald Trump had grown "detached from reality" on his election fraud claims, as multiple aides testified to the House Jan. 6 committee they told him he'd lost. https://t.co/bNinLyfQd8

Fox News is broadcasting the second day of the House committee hearing on the Jan. 6 attack after not carrying the first day. The network's hosts told their audience that the committee hearing last week was nothing more than "propaganda." https://t.co/hOV3ctrd0z

Andrew Giuliani said he will not be able to attend the first Republican debate in the New York City governor’s race unless he sends proof of his Covid vaccination status, which he will not do. He says he is unvaccinated and has "natural immunity." https://t.co/HxNwYP2h5E

The criminal trial of a man who carried a Confederate flag into the Capitol during the Jan. 6 attack begins on Monday. The man and his son have been charged with crimes including obstructing the final certification of the presidential election. https://t.co/AINQkL4jNj

Google placed an engineer on paid leave after dismissing his claim that its AI is sentient.
The company said its systems imitated conversational exchanges but did not have consciousness. https://t.co/zDUdQENPhs https://t.co/yAingzDnQV

The New York Times obtained secret Pentagon photos of the first prisoners brought to Guantánamo Bay.
If taken by news photographers, these images of the wartime prison would not survive censorship rules imposed by the U.S. military at Guantánamo today. https://t.co/YRUsuzBtQq https://t.co/DLjVTzcnfE

Google has settled a class-action lawsuit that accused it of systematically underpaying women, promising to provide $118 million in monetary relief and invite outsiders to review its practices. https://t.co/fswrnMGIfX

Jennifer Hudson became an EGOT at the #TonyAwards on Sunday. 🏆
When "A Strange Loop" won best new musical, Hudson, one of the show's co-producers, joined a select group of people who have won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony. https://t.co/eVPpp8hgwr https://t.co/i4UwkWL1V1

For 20 years, the U.S. military tightly controlled what the world saw of Guantánamo Bay detainees. Few explicit images of prisoners became public. Until now.
The New York Times obtained photos from the secret Pentagon archive of the prison's first days. https://t.co/E3mOQXArSv

Gasoline prices reached a grim milestone on Saturday, as the national average for regular gasoline reached $5 a gallon.
A year ago, gas sold for $3.08. https://t.co/fUY7k4OYA8

Joaquina Kalukango, who plays a resilient Civil War-era bar owner in “Paradise Square,” just won her first Tony for best leading actress in a musical. #TonyAwards https://t.co/y60b9VDy0e https://t.co/aWF34sGoMb

McDonald’s restaurants reopened in Russia this weekend, but without the Golden Arches. After the American fast-food giant pulled out this spring to protest Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine, a Siberian oil mogul bought its 840 Russian stores. https://t.co/G6n3PMgwlO https://t.co/EEwaOFPgz7

Myles Frost, 22, won his first Tony Award for his depiction of Michael Jackson in “MJ.” In his acceptance speech, he thanked his mom.
"You taught me and showed me what a strong Black woman is and what it means to raise a strong Black man." #TonyAwards https://t.co/UWbyVb7s3y https://t.co/60cwKAgJzq

Jennifer Hudson just became an EGOT at the #TonyAwards. 🏆
When "A Strange Loop" won best new musical, Hudson, one of the show’s co-producers, joined a select group of people who have won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony. https://t.co/aP7CS5W3hZ https://t.co/tT8ec5wPSM

Patti LuPone, one of Broadway’s most beloved stars, won her third Tony Award for her showstopping performance as Joanne in the revival of Stephen Sondheim’s "Company." #TonyAwards https://t.co/63hBqIELkM https://t.co/uXpyMkHzBP
Breaking News: Senators struck a bipartisan deal on a narrow set of gun safety measures, bringing them closer to ending a yearslong congressional impasse. https://t.co/ecWuK8VSkN

The House Jan. 6 committee plans to use the testimony of Donald Trump's own campaign manager, Bill Stepien, against the former president on Monday, as it lays out evidence that Trump knowingly spread the lie that the 2020 election was stolen. https://t.co/JH6gAv2PIU

President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil is trailing in polls for the country’s presidential race. He said that if he loses, it will most likely be thanks to a stolen vote.
Now he has enlisted a new ally in his fight against the electoral process: the military. https://t.co/lta4NLNiV8

Of the 10 Republican senators supporting a bipartisan deal on gun safety, four are leaving Congress at the end of the year and five are not up for re-election for another four years. Only Mitt Romney of Utah will face voters in 2024. https://t.co/ERcK7TwGwY https://t.co/q3YKb1MZlx

On the 108th day of Vladimir Putin’s unprovoked war on Ukraine, Russia appeared no closer to victory. But its forces did appear to be making slow, methodical and bloody progress toward control of eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/Z3WbcC5WxH

Google placed an engineer on paid leave after dismissing his claim that its artificial intelligence is sentient. The company’s human resources department said he had violated Google’s confidentiality policy. https://t.co/GUcDXAFT8K
They were sterilized without consent as young girls. What does the government owe them — and thousands of other living victims? https://t.co/bBSQ8cxe2D

It’s soft. It’s vegan. It’s made from fossil fuels.
The fashion industry has been transformed by the rebranding of synthetic materials into hip alternatives like "vegan leather," a marketing masterstroke meant to suggest environmental virtue. https://t.co/sGYW1z8Gx0

Dozens of members of the right-wing group Patriot Front were detained and charged with conspiracy to riot, after the police said they received a tip that a group of people had jumped into a U-Haul van near a Pride event in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho. https://t.co/nagfJxDerE https://t.co/Sd1CKTVmGb

A Senate gun safety plan endorsed by 10 Republicans and 10 Democrats falls far short of reforms long championed by gun control activists and a majority of congressional Democrats. It amounts to notable, albeit narrow, progress amid deep party divisions. https://t.co/WEFNp05vCL https://t.co/KNCaulTD1s

He had means, motive and opportunity. But did Donald Trump commit a crime?
Several former prosecutors and veteran lawyers said the first prime-time Jan. 6 committee hearing offered the makings of a credible criminal case. https://t.co/W2qELdQVI0

The day before Jan. 6, 2021, Mike Pence's chief counsel laid out in a three-page memo that the vice president would violate federal law if he bowed to pressure from Donald Trump to interfere with the certification of Joe Biden's victory. https://t.co/dWVJxlOnX3

Dozens of members of a white supremacist group were arrested on Saturday in Idaho before they could act on plans to riot at a local Pride event, police said. An apparent leader of the group had a seven-page document outlining a plan in extensive detail. https://t.co/46cSB8tihH

Moderna’s coronavirus vaccine for children under 6 is effective in preventing symptomatic infection without causing worrisome side effects, the Food and Drug Administration said on Friday night. https://t.co/hPQVyjlpVS

Ukraine is running short of Soviet-era ammunition and has not received enough from its allies, hampering its artillery war in the country’s east to keep the Russians at bay, officials say. https://t.co/ywhQPFaG6l

"This is a renaissance."
The nation's HBCUs are experiencing a boom in enrollment, as they're embraced by a generation shaped by the first Black president, Black Lives Matter and shifting views on what constitutes the pinnacle of higher education. https://t.co/t3mqgCDiVJ https://t.co/72A7lV24cF

In Opinion
The prime-time Jan. 6 committee hearing "was about Trump as a callous monster, and many will come away convinced that he should be criminally charged and put in jail," @maureendowd writes. "Lock him up!" https://t.co/HS5zUYC73s

"The Wire," which premiered in June 2002, told a sweeping story of crime, punishment and institutional disintegration in Baltimore. 20 years on, some of the show’s stars looked back and broke down some of its most pivotal scenes. https://t.co/DSrAPjCiJb
